text:
today we're going to do something really simple 
it's got only two ingredients, shrimp and salt.

They were alive this morning, it's always good to 
have fresh shrimp, just drain them off a little

and as you can see they're a very good 
size. we're going to thread these onto

some skewers. We're not going to take the 
heads off. I'm using these bamboo skewers,

I find they are better than the 
round skewers, these are rectangular.

The round skewers are ok but things tend to roll 
off them, so if you can if you can get these I

highly recommend them. So this is pretty simple, 
you just have to take the skewer and insert it

where the sun doesn't shine and feed it all 
the way through to the head of the shrimp,

just like that. It doesn't get much simpler than 
that. I have noticed people grilling shrimp for

15 minutes 20 minutes and so on, that's total 
overkill. The faster you can do it on the

highest temperature without burning the shells 
is what I always aim for. So we'll get these

on these skewers and we've already got the 
charcoal running and it's ready to cook on.

you can add flavor to shrimp as well 
but i personally think they're better

as is in their natural state just with assault 
and i'm going to be using a lot of salt

but it's only going to be going on the shell 
and some of it as you peel them when you're

eating them will get transferred through to 
the meat but it's not going to be over salted

just feed them through just like that and it's 
always good to use slightly larger shrimp you

don't want to do small shrimp they're 
just they're too small so here we go

all right i'll just spray a little 
oil on this grate here just to

stop any potential sticking and so the 
first step is add some salt over here
flip them over and do both sides
and onto the grill

so just keep turning them and try and 
avoid getting the shells burnt if you can

we've got a super hot fire here the charcoal 
is only a couple of inches from the grate

you don't want to leave them alone 
otherwise you will overcook them
just like that

They  just takes a few minutes to cook, they 
look great and they taste great as well

you really don't want to burn them because 
the shells are pretty much like fingernails

burning here so unless you 
like the burning hair taste

all right i think these are done time to 
take them off and just in time because it's

about to start raining so off they go under 
the plate and perfect take a look at that

all right slice up a bit of lime or 
lemon whatever tickles your fancy and

these things are ready to go pretty 
as a picture off with the head
down the hatch
wow so good
this is so good and so easy that

you'll never waste your time putting all sorts of 
flavors on the shrimp just get the shrimp flavor
wow

no that was good if you want to get the 
recipe just go to barbecuepitboys.com

and there you'll find over a 
thousand recipes to choose from

and you've got our seasonings and 
rubs all there so check it out
